uk.ac.ed.inf.nmr.readers
Class NestedReaderBF

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ed.inf.nmr.readers.NestedReaderBF
All Implemented Interfaces:
CommonReaderUtils
public class NestedReaderBF
extends java.lang.Object
implements CommonReaderUtils

Class implementing a BufferReader that is used to read the output of the nested job or intermediate file depending on the type that the user provides.

Author:
Daniel Stanoescu

          Configuration required to setup a SequenceFile.

Constructor Detail

NestedReaderBF

@Deprecated
public NestedReaderBF(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Mapper.Context context)
               throws java.io.IOException

Throws:
java.io.IOException

NestedReaderBF

public NestedReaderBF(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Mapper.Context context,
                      org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path innerWorks,
                      java.lang.String jobName,
                      java.lang.String condition)
               throws java.io.IOException
Reads the text from the intermediary file or the output of the nested job if one has been started.

Parameters:
context - Uses the Mapper context to configure the SequenceFile writer.
innerWorks - Gets the root directory for the output of the outer job.
jobName - Uses the name of the job to save the intermediate file so it can be identified by the job that required it.
condition - Provides the name of the job that it will read from.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

NestedReaderBF

@Deprecated
public NestedReaderBF(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Reducer.Context context)
               throws java.io.IOException
Deprecated. 

Throws:
java.io.IOException

                      java.lang.String condition)
               throws java.io.IOException
Reads the text from the intermediary file or the output of the nested job if one has been started.

Parameters:
context - Uses the Reducer context to configure the SequenceFile writer.
innerWorks - Gets the root directory for the output of the outer job.
jobName - Uses the name of the job to save the intermediate file so it can be identified by the job that required it.
condition - Provides the name of the job that it will read from.

java.io.IOException
